column4: UPDATE 3-More than 230 000 without power in US East after storms
column5: Dec 21 More than 230 000 homes and businesses were without power in the Eastern half of the United States Friday afternoon  down from over 320 000 earlier in the day  after a series of snow and rain storms battered the area  power companies said.     The hardest hit states Friday afternoon were Michigan  Wisconsin  New York and New Jersey  but outages also remained in Arkansas  Louisiana  Texas  Nebraska and Iowa from storms on Thursday.     Storms knocked out power to more than 680

column4: Italy government welcomes GE acquisition of Avio
column5: ROME The Italian government welcomed the acquisition of the aviation unit of aerospace supplier Avio by U.S. giant General Electric   saying on Friday it was a demonstration of Italy's attractiveness to foreign and domestic investors.

column4: TEXT-S&P:GE rating unaffected by purchase Of Avio SpA
column5: Dec 21 - Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said today that the announcement by General Electric Co. (GE; AA+/Stable/A-1+) that it is purchasing Italy-based aerospace group Avio SpA (not rated) for about EUR3.3 billion does not affect our ratings or outlook on GE. We assume the purchase will be funded from operating cash flow  and we expect it to close  around mid to late 2013. The majority of Avio's aviation business is as a  long-time supplier to GE's aviation business.

column4: GE to invest $1.1 billion in Avio aviation unit in next ten years

column4: Regulator plans to sanction JPMorgan on "Whale" trade-report
column5: Dec 20 A U.S. bank regulator is planning to issue a formal action against JPMorgan Chase & Co  demanding that the bank fix lapses in risk controls that allowed some of its traders to build a risky bet that lost $6.2 billion  the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Panasonic to appeal EU ruling on cathode-ray tube cartel
column5: TOKYO  Dec 21 Japan's Panasonic Corp  said on Friday that it would appeal a decision by the European Commission to fine it 252 million euros ($327 million) on charges of fixing prices for TV and computer monitor cathode-ray tubes along with five other companies.

column4: UPDATE 2-EU starts safety review of Merck cholesterol drug
column5: LONDON  Dec 21 Europe's medicines watchdog has launched a review of Merck & Co Inc's cholesterol drug Tredaptive after the medicine failed a U.S. trial assessing its effectiveness and safety.

column4: European watchdog starts safety review of Merck cholesterol drug
column5: LONDON The European Medicines Agency said it has launched a review of Merck & Co Inc's cholesterol drug Tredaptive after the medicine failed a U.S. trial assessing its effectiveness and safety.

column4: European watchdog starts safety review of Merck cholesterol drug
column5: LONDON  Dec 21 The European Medicines Agency said it has launched a review of Merck & Co Inc's  cholesterol drug Tredaptive after the medicine failed in a large-scale study.

column4: BRIEF-EMA says starts safety review of Merck's Tredaptive drug
column5: LONDON  Dec 21 EMA:  * European medicines agency starts review of tredaptive  pelzont and trevaclyn

column4: Greece's National Bank posts wider nine-month loss
column5: ATHENS  Dec 21 Greece's largest lender National Bank on Friday reported a wider nine-month loss  hurt by provisions for impaired loans amid the country's severe debt crisis.

column4: UPDATE 3-More than 230 000 without power in US East after storms
column5: Dec 21 More than 230 000 homes and businesses were without power in the Eastern half of the United States Friday afternoon  down from over 320 000 earlier in the day  after a series of snow and rain storms battered the area  power companies said.     The hardest hit states Friday afternoon were Michigan  Wisconsin  New York and New Jersey  but outages also remained in Arkansas  Louisiana  Texas  Nebraska and Iowa from storms on Thursday.     Storms knocked out power to more than 680

column4: TEXT-S&P summary: Prudential PLC
The fall and (partial) rise of Royal Bank of Scotland
column5: LONDON  Dec 21 (IFR) - Alistair Darling had little idea of exactly what he was buying when he signed off on a 20 billion pound state rescue of the Royal Bank of Scotland just after 6am on October 13 2008.

column4: Finland to support STX if it wins luxury ship deal
column5: HELSINKI  Dec 21 Finland will support STX's shipyard in Turku  southern Finland  with 28 million euros ($37 million) if the South Korean group wins a 1 billion euro cruise ship deal from Royal Caribbean.

column4: Olympus  Sony say medical business merger delayed
column5: TOKYO Japan's Olympus Corp  and Sony Corp  said on Friday that a planned merger of the two firms' medical business will take longer than expected due to delays in obtaining regulatory approval abroad.

column4: UPDATE 1-Olympus  Sony say medical business merger delayed
column5: * Olympus shares down 1.8 pct  Sony shares flat   (Adds Sony comment  shares)

column4: Olympus says medical business merger with Sony delayed
column5: TOKYO  Dec 21 Japan's Olympus Corp said on Friday that a planned merger of its medical business with Sony Corp would take longer than expected due to delays in obtaining regulatory approval abroad.

column4: Dish seeks more time to fight Sprint's Softbank  Clearwire deals
column5: NEW YORK Dish Network  has asked the U.S. telecom regulator for more time to file an objection to wireless service provider Sprint Nextel's  proposed sale of a controlling stake to Japan's SoftBank Corp  due to Sprint's announcement this week of a plan to buy out Clearwire Corp .

column4: Dish seeks more time to fight Sprint's Softbank  Clearwire deals
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 21 Dish Network has asked the U.S. telecom regulator for more time to file an objection to wireless service provider Sprint Nextel's proposed sale of a controlling stake to Japan's SoftBank Corp due to Sprint's announcement this week of a plan to buy out Clearwire Corp.

column4: UPDATE 2-Statoil gives go-ahead on $7 bln UK North Sea project
column5: OSLO  Dec 21 Norway's Statoil has decided to go ahead with a $7 billion project to develop the North Sea Mariner oil field discovered 31 years ago  it said on Friday  giving a boost to the UK offshore industry after years of decline.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Statoil to develop 31-year old UK oil discovery for $7 bln
column5: OSLO  Dec 21 Norway's Statoil has taken a 31-year old British oil discovery off the shelf  approving a $7 billion development that could produce more than 250 million barrels of oil over a 30-year period  it said on Friday.

column4: Statoil to invest $7 bln in British offshore project
column5: OSLO  Dec 21 Norway's Statoil will invest $7 billion to develop the Mariner project  the biggest offshore oil and gas development in Britain in over a decade  it said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Statoil and ExxonMobil find more gas off Tanzania
column5: OSLO  Dec 21 Norwegian energy firm Statoil  found more gas offshore Tanzania  its third discovery in the country this year  putting it closer to having the resource needed to make commercial development viable.

column4: Statoil makes another gas discovery off Tanzania
column5: OSLO  Dec 21 Norwegian energy firm Statoil  made another natural gas discovery in the Lavani-2 epxplorationa and appraisal well in Tanzania  the company said on Friday.

column4: TJX buys off-price online retailer in e-commerce push
column5: TJX Cos Inc  said it bought Sierra Trading Post  an off-price Internet retailer  for about $200 million  the latest brick-and-mortar store to try to attract customers who shop online via smartphones and tablets.

column4: U.S. ruling on Keystone pipeline could slip again - report
column5: CALGARY  Alberta A top risk-management analyst warned on Friday that a decision by Washington on TransCanada Corp's  Keystone XL pipeline could get delayed again into next summer  adding more pressure to already deeply discounted Canadian oil prices.

column4: BRIEF-Neste Oil files new patent infringement action vs Tyson Foods  others
column5: HELSINKI  Dec 21 Neste Oil Oyj :  * Says filed new patent infringement action against Tyson Foods and others. Move follows patent infringement action against same defendants earlier this year.

column4: Union Pacific to adjust signal at Texas crash site
column5: SAN ANGELO  Texas Union Pacific Corp said on Thursday that it will adjust the signal system at the Midland  Texas  train crossing where four veterans were killed when a freight train the company operated slammed into a parade float last month.

column4: Union Pacific to adjust signal at Texas crash site
column5: SAN ANGELO  Texas  Dec 20 Union Pacific Corp  said on Thursday that it will adjust the signal system at the Midland  Texas  train crossing where four veterans were killed when a freight train the company operated slammed into a parade float last month.

column4: U.S. appeals court revives VeriFone restatement lawsuit
column5: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. appeals court on Friday revived a proposed securities class action against VeriFone Systems Inc over its 2007 restatement of results  ruling that the lawsuit properly alleged VeriFone Chief Executive Douglas Bergeron was "reckless" as to the truth of financial reports.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. appeals court revives VeriFone restatement lawsuit
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 21 A U.S. appeals court on Friday revived a proposed securities class action against VeriFone Systems Inc over its 2007 restatement of results  ruling that the lawsuit properly alleged VeriFone Chief Executive Douglas Bergeron was "reckless" as to the truth of financial reports.

column4: U.S. Appeals court revives lawsuit over VeriFone restatement
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 21 A U.S. appeals court revived a proposed securities class action against VeriFone Systems Inc over a 2007 restatement  ruling that the plaintiff investors properly alleged that VeriFone executives were "reckless" as to the truth of financial reports.

column4: Consumer sentiment slumps in December as fiscal woes weigh
column5: NEW YORK Consumer sentiment slumped in December as Americans were rattled by on-going negotiations to avert the tax hikes and spending cuts set to come into effect in the new year  data showed on Friday.

column4: Wells Fargo agrees to proposed settlement on shareholder actions
column5: Wells Fargo & Co would pay up to $2.5 million in attorneys' fees and implement certain corporate governance changes under a proposed settlement of lawsuits brought by shareholders on behalf of the company  according to a securities filing by Wells on Friday.

column4: Wells Fargo agrees to proposed settlement on shareholder actions
column5: Dec 21 Wells Fargo & Co would pay up to $2.5 million in attorneys' fees and implement certain corporate governance changes under a proposed settlement of lawsuits brought by shareholders on behalf of the company  according to a securities filing by Wells on Friday.

column4: Winnebago to raise output after strong demand boosts first-quarter
column5: Winnebago Industries Inc   the largest U.S. motor home maker  said it plans to increase its production in the current quarter to meet the high demand that also helped it report stronger-than-expected first-quarter results.

column4: China probes safety of Yum Brands' KFC chicken products
column5: SHANGHAI Yum Brands Inc's fast-food chain KFC was supplied with chicken in China that contained excessive amounts of antibiotics  said food safety authorities investigating allegations of tainted KFC products.
